intro: Callista falcorostra, commonly known as the narrow-leafed callista, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
